bill_title: provide transportation allowances for certain students  attending schools outside the resident school district.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide transportation allowances for certain students attending schools outside the resident school district. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any school district closes an elementary or secondary school after July 1, 1996, any student who would otherwise have been assigned to the school that was closed is entitled to allowances for transportation, room, and board as provided in § 13-30-1 for school attendance in a district other than the student's resident school district if the school in the nonresident district is closer to the student's residence than the closest school in the student's resident school district. The allowance for any such student shall be paid by the resident district, including cases in which the student is enrolled in the nonresident district pursuant to § 13-28-40. Any allowance authorized pursuant to this Act shall be paid for the 1998-1999 school year and for each school year thereafter. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
